{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, radical neck dissection refers to the removal of levels I-V along with the SCM, IJV, and CN XI. The modified radical neck dissection also removes levels I-V but spares at least one non-lymphatic structure (SCM, IJV, or CN XI). Based on this information, the structure that is not removed in radical neck dissection is the Submandibular (choice B). Therefore, the correct answer is B. Submandibular.", "answer_choice": "B"}
